013package org.apache.juneau.rest.logger;
014
015import static java.util.logging.Level.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.Enablement.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.rest.logger.CallLoggingDetail.*;
021
022import java.util.*;
023import java.util.function.*;
024import java.util.logging.*;
025
026import jakarta.servlet.http.*;
027
028import org.apache.juneau.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
032import org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.*;
033import org.apache.juneau.rest.stats.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.rest.util.*;
035
036/**
037 * Basic implementation of a {@link CallLogger} for logging HTTP requests.
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * Provides the following capabilities:
041 * <ul>
042 *    <li>Allows incoming HTTP requests to be logged at various {@link Enablement detail levels}.
043 *    <li>Allows rules to be defined to handle request logging differently depending on the resulting status code.
044 *    <li>Allows use of stack trace hashing to eliminate duplication of stack traces in log files.
045 *    <li>Allows customization of handling of where requests are logged to.
046 *    <li>Allows configuration via system properties or environment variables.
047 * </ul>
048 *
049 * <p>
050 * The following is an example of a logger that logs errors only when debugging is not enabled, and everything when
051 * logging is enabled.
052 *
053 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
054 * <p class='bjava'>
055 *       CallLogger <jv>logger</jv> = CallLogger
056 *          .<jsm>create</jsm>()
057 *          .logger(<js>"MyLogger"</js>)  <jc>// Use MyLogger Java logger.</jc>
058 *          .normalRules(  <jc>// Rules when debugging is not enabled.</jc>
059 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log 500+ errors with status-line and header information.</jc>
060 *                .statusFilter(x -&gt; x &gt;= 500)
061 *                .level(<jsf>SEVERE</jsf>)
062 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>HEADER</jsf>)
063 *                .responseDetail<jsf>(HEADER</jsf>)
064 *                .build(),
065 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log 400-500 errors with just status-line information.</jc>
066 *                .statusFilter(x -&gt; x &gt;= 400)
067 *                .level(<jsf>WARNING</jsf>)
068 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>STATUS_LINE</jsf>)
069 *                .responseDetail(<jsf>STATUS_LINE</jsf>)
070 *                .build()
071 *          )
072 *          .debugRules(  <jc>// Rules when debugging is enabled.</jc>
073 *             <jsm>createRule</jsm>()  <jc>// Log everything with full details.</jc>
074 *                .level(<jsf>SEVERE</jsf>)
075 *                .requestDetail(<jsf>ENTITY</jsf>)
076 *                .responseDetail(<jsf>ENTITY</jsf>)
077 *                .build()
078 *          )
079 *          .build()
080 *       ;
081 * </p>
082 *
083 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
084 *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#callLogger()}
085 *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#debugEnablement()}
086 *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#debug}
087 *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#debug}
088 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../index.html#jrs.LoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
089 * </ul>
090 */
091public class CallLogger {
092
093   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
094   // Static
095   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
096
097   private static final CallLoggerRule DEFAULT_RULE = CallLoggerRule.create(BeanStore.INSTANCE).build();
098
099   /** Represents no logger */
100   public abstract class Void extends CallLogger {
101      Void(BeanStore beanStore) {
102         super(beanStore);
103      }
104   }
105
106   /**
107    * System property name for the default logger name to use for {@link CallLogger} objects.
108    * <p>
109    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER</c> environment variable.
110    * <p>
111    * If not specified, the default is <js>"global"</js>.
112    */
113   public static final String SP_logger = "juneau.restLogger.logger";
114
115   /**
116    * System property name for the default enablement setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
117    * <p>
118    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_ENABLED</c> environment variable.
119    * <p>
120    * The possible values are:
121    * <ul>
122    *    <li>{@link Enablement#ALWAYS "ALWAYS"} (default) - Logging is enabled.
123    *    <li>{@link Enablement#NEVER "NEVER"} - Logging is disabled.
124    *    <li>{@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL "CONDITIONALLY"} - Logging is enabled if it passes the {@link Builder#enabledTest(Predicate)} test.
125    * </ul>
126    */
127   public static final String SP_enabled = "juneau.restLogger.enabled";
128
129   /**
130    * System property name for the default request detail setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
131    * <p>
132    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_REQUESTDETAIL</c> environment variable.
133    *
134    * <ul class='values'>
135    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE "STATUS_LINE"} (default) - Log only the status line.
136    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER "HEADER"} - Log the status line and headers.
137    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY "ENTITY"} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
138    * </ul>
139    */
140   public static final String SP_requestDetail = "juneau.restLogger.requestDetail";
141
142   /**
143    * System property name for the default response detail setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
144    * <p>
145    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_RESPONSEDETAIL</c> environment variable.
146    *
147    * <ul class='values'>
148    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE "STATUS_LINE"} (default) - Log only the status line.
149    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER "HEADER"} - Log the status line and headers.
150    *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY "ENTITY"} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
151    * </ul>
152    */
153   public static final String SP_responseDetail = "juneau.restLogger.responseDetail";
154
155   /**
156    * System property name for the logging level setting for {@link CallLogger} objects.
157    * <p>
158    * Can also use a <c>JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LEVEL</c> environment variable.
159    *
160    * <ul class='values'>
161    *    <li>{@link Level#OFF "OFF"} (default)
162    *    <li>{@link Level#SEVERE "SEVERE"}
163    *    <li>{@link Level#WARNING "WARNING"}
164    *    <li>{@link Level#INFO "INFO"}
165    *    <li>{@link Level#CONFIG "CONFIG"}
166    *    <li>{@link Level#FINE "FINE"}
167    *    <li>{@link Level#FINER "FINER"}
168    *    <li>{@link Level#FINEST "FINEST"}
169    * </ul>
170    */
171   public static final String SP_level = "juneau.restLogger.level";
172
173   /**
174    * Static creator.
175    *
176    * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
177    * @return A new builder for this object.
178    */
179   public static Builder create(BeanStore beanStore) {
180      return new Builder(beanStore);
181   }
182
183   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
184   // Builder
185   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
186
187   /**
188    * Builder class.
189    */
190   @FluentSetters
191   public static class Builder {
192
193      Logger logger;
194      ThrownStore thrownStore;
195      List<CallLoggerRule> normalRules = Utils.list(), debugRules = Utils.list();
196      Enablement enabled;
197      Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest;
198      CallLoggingDetail requestDetail, responseDetail;
199      Level level;
200
201      /**
202       * Constructor.
203       *
204       * @param beanStore The bean store to use for creating beans.
205       */
206      protected Builder(BeanStore beanStore) {
207         logger = Logger.getLogger(env(SP_logger, "global"));
208         enabled = env(SP_enabled, ALWAYS);
209         enabledTest = x -> false;
210         requestDetail = env(SP_requestDetail, STATUS_LINE);
211         responseDetail = env(SP_responseDetail, STATUS_LINE);
212         level = env(SP_level).map(Level::parse).orElse(OFF);
213      }
214
215      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
216      // Properties
217      //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
218
219      /**
220       * Specifies the logger to use for logging the request.
221       *
222       * <p>
223       * If not specified, the logger name is determined in the following order:
224       * <ol>
225       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "juneau.restLogger.logger"} system property.
226       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER"} environment variable.
227       *    <li><js>"global"</js>.
228       * </ol>
229       *
230       * <p>
231       * The {@link CallLogger#getLogger()} method can also be overridden to provide different logic.
232       *
233       * @param value
234       *    The logger to use for logging the request.
235       * @return This object.
236       */
237      public Builder logger(Logger value) {
238         logger = value;
239         return this;
240      }
241
242      /**
243       * Specifies the logger to use for logging the request.
244       *
245       * <p>
246       * Shortcut for calling <c>logger(Logger.<jsm>getLogger</jsm>(value))</c>.
247       *
248       * <p>
249       * If not specified, the logger name is determined in the following order:
250       * <ol>
251       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "juneau.restLogger.logger"} system property.
252       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_logger "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_LOGGER"} environment variable.
253       *    <li><js>"global"</js>.
254       * </ol>
255       *
256       * <p>
257       * The {@link CallLogger#getLogger()} method can also be overridden to provide different logic.
258       *
259       * @param value
260       *    The logger to use for logging the request.
261       * @return This object.
262       */
263      public Builder logger(String value) {
264         logger = value == null ? null :Logger.getLogger(value);
265         return this;
266      }
267
268      /**
269       * Same as {@link #logger(Logger)} but only sets the value if it's currently <jk>null</jk>.
270       *
271       * @param value The logger to use for logging the request.
272       * @return This object.
273       */
274      public Builder loggerOnce(Logger value) {
275         if (logger == null)
276            logger = value;
277         return this;
278      }
279
280      /**
281       * Specifies the thrown exception store to use for getting stack trace information (hash IDs and occurrence counts).
282       *
283       * @param value
284       *    The stack trace store.
285       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, stack trace information will not be logged.
286       * @return This object.
287       */
288      public Builder thrownStore(ThrownStore value) {
289         thrownStore = value;
290         return this;
291      }
292
293      /**
294       * Same as {@link #thrownStore(ThrownStore)} but only sets the value if it's currently <jk>null</jk>.
295       *
296       * @param value
297       *    The stack trace store.
298       *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, stack trace information will not be logged.
299       * @return This object.
300       */
301      public Builder thrownStoreOnce(ThrownStore value) {
302         if (thrownStore == null)
303            thrownStore = value;
304         return this;
305      }
306      /**
307       * Specifies the default logging enablement setting.
308       *
309       * <p>
310       * This specifies the default logging enablement value if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
311       *
312       * <p>
313       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
314       * <ul>
315       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_enabled "juneau.restLogger.enabled"} system property.
316       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_enabled "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_ENABLED"} environment variable.
317       *    <li><js>"ALWAYS"</js>.
318       * </ul>
319       *
320       * <ul class='values'>
321       *    <li>{@link Enablement#ALWAYS ALWAYS} (default) - Logging is enabled.
322       *    <li>{@link Enablement#NEVER NEVER} - Logging is disabled.
323       *    <li>{@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL CONDITIONALLY} - Logging is enabled if it passes the {@link #enabledTest(Predicate)} test.
324       * </ul>
325       *
326       * <p>
327       * @param value
328       *    The default enablement flag value.  Can be <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
329       * @return This object.
330       */
331      public Builder enabled(Enablement value) {
332         enabled = value;
333         return this;
334      }
335
336      /**
337       * Specifies the default logging enablement test predicate.
338       *
339       * <p>
340       * This specifies the default logging enablement test if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
341       *
342       * <p>
343       * This setting has no effect if the enablement setting is not {@link Enablement#CONDITIONAL CONDITIONALLY}.
344       *
345       * <p>
346       * The default if not specified is <c><jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jk>false</jk></c> (never log).
347       *
348       * @param value
349       *    The default enablement flag value.  Can be <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
350       * @return This object.
351       */
352      public Builder enabledTest(Predicate<HttpServletRequest> value) {
353         enabledTest = value;
354         return this;
355      }
356
357      /**
358       * Shortcut for calling <c>enabled(<jsf>NEVER</jsf>)</c>.
359       *
360       * @return This object.
361       */
362      public Builder disabled() {
363         return enabled(NEVER);
364      }
365
366      /**
367       * The default level of detail to log on a request.
368       *
369       * <p>
370       * This specifies the default level of request detail if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
371       *
372       * <p>
373       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
374       * <ul>
375       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_requestDetail "juneau.restLogger.requestDetail"} system property.
376       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_requestDetail "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_requestDetail"} environment variable.
377       *    <li><js>"STATUS_LINE"</js>.
378       * </ul>
379       *
380       * <ul class='values'>
381       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE STATUS_LINE} - Log only the status line.
382       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER HEADER} - Log the status line and headers.
383       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY ENTITY} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
384       * </ul>
385       *
386       * @param value
387       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
388       * @return This object.
389       */
390      public Builder requestDetail(CallLoggingDetail value) {
391         requestDetail = value;
392         return this;
393      }
394
395      /**
396       * The default level of detail to log on a response.
397       *
398       * <p>
399       * This specifies the default level of response detail if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
400       *
401       * <p>
402       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
403       * <ul>
404       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_responseDetail "juneau.restLogger.responseDetail"} system property.
405       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_responseDetail "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_responseDetail"} environment variable.
406       *    <li><js>"STATUS_LINE"</js>.
407       * </ul>
408       *
409       * <ul class='values'>
410       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#STATUS_LINE STATUS_LINE} - Log only the status line.
411       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#HEADER HEADER} - Log the status line and headers.
412       *    <li>{@link CallLoggingDetail#ENTITY ENTITY} - Log the status line and headers and content if available.
413       * </ul>
414       *
415       * @param value
416       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default.
417       * @return This object.
418       */
419      public Builder responseDetail(CallLoggingDetail value) {
420         responseDetail = value;
421         return this;
422      }
423
424      /**
425       * The default logging level to use for logging the request/response.
426       *
427       * <p>
428       * This specifies the default logging level if not set on the first matched rule or if no rules match.
429       *
430       * <p>
431       * If not specified, the setting is determined via the following:
432       * <ul>
433       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_level "juneau.restLogger.level"} system property.
434       *    <li><js>{@link CallLogger#SP_level "JUNEAU_RESTLOGGER_level"} environment variable.
435       *    <li><js>"OFF"</js>.
436       * </ul>
437       *
438       * @param value
439       *    The new value for this property, or <jk>null</jk> to use the default value.
440       * @return This object.
441       */
442      public Builder level(Level value) {
443         level = value;
444         return this;
445      }
446
447      /**
448       * Adds logging rules to use when debug mode is not enabled.
449       *
450       * <p>
451       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
452       *
453       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
454       * @return This object.
455       */
456      public Builder normalRules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
457         for (CallLoggerRule rule : values)
458            normalRules.add(rule);
459         return this;
460      }
461
462      /**
463       * Adds logging rules to use when debug mode is enabled.
464       *
465       * <p>
466       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
467       *
468       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
469       * @return This object.
470       */
471      public Builder debugRules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
472         for (CallLoggerRule rule : values)
473            debugRules.add(rule);
474         return this;
475      }
476
477      /**
478       * Shortcut for adding the same rules as normal and debug rules.
479       *
480       * <p>
481       * Logging rules are matched in the order they are added.  The first to match wins.
482       *
483       * @param values The logging rules to add to the list of rules.
484       * @return This object.
485       */
486      public Builder rules(CallLoggerRule...values) {
487         return normalRules(values).debugRules(values);
488      }
489
490      /**
491       * Instantiates a new call logger based on the settings in this builder.
492       *
493       * @return A new call logger.
494       */
495      public CallLogger build() {
496         return new CallLogger(this);
497      }
498
499      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
500      // Fluent setters
501      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
502
503      // <FluentSetters>
504
505      // </FluentSetters>
506   }
507
508   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
509   // Instance
510   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
511
512   private final Logger logger;
513   private final ThrownStore thrownStore;
514   private final CallLoggerRule[] normalRules, debugRules;
515   private final Enablement enabled;
516   private final Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest;
517   private final Level level;
518   private final CallLoggingDetail requestDetail, responseDetail;
519
520   /**
521    * Constructor.
522    * <p>
523    * Subclasses typically override the {@link #init(BeanStore)} method when using this constructor.
524    *
525    * @param beanStore The bean store containing injectable beans for this logger.
526    */
527   public CallLogger(BeanStore beanStore) {
528      Builder builder = init(beanStore);
529      this.logger = builder.logger;
530      this.thrownStore = builder.thrownStore;
531      this.normalRules = builder.normalRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.normalRules.size()]);
532      this.debugRules = builder.debugRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.debugRules.size()]);
533      this.enabled = builder.enabled;
534      this.enabledTest = builder.enabledTest;
535      this.requestDetail = builder.requestDetail;
536      this.responseDetail = builder.responseDetail;
537      this.level = builder.level;
538   }
539
540   /**
541    * Constructor.
542    *
543    * @param builder The builder for this logger.
544    */
545   public CallLogger(Builder builder) {
546      this.logger = builder.logger;
547      this.thrownStore = builder.thrownStore;
548      this.normalRules = builder.normalRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.normalRules.size()]);
549      this.debugRules = builder.debugRules.toArray(new CallLoggerRule[builder.debugRules.size()]);
550      this.enabled = builder.enabled;
551      this.enabledTest = builder.enabledTest;
552      this.requestDetail = builder.requestDetail;
553      this.responseDetail = builder.responseDetail;
554      this.level = builder.level;
555   }
556
557   /**
558    * Initializer.
559    * <p>
560    * Subclasses should override this method to make modifications to the builder used to create this logger.
561    *
562    * @param beanStore The bean store containing injectable beans for this logger.
563    * @return A new builder object.
564    */
565   protected Builder init(BeanStore beanStore) {
566      return new Builder(beanStore)
567         .logger(beanStore.getBean(Logger.class).orElse(null))
568         .thrownStore(beanStore.getBean(ThrownStore.class).orElse(null));
569   }
570
571   /**
572    * Called at the end of a servlet request to log the request.
573    *
574    * @param req The servlet request.
575    * @param res The servlet response.
576    */
577   public void log(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
578
579      CallLoggerRule rule = getRule(req, res);
580
581      if (! isEnabled(rule, req))
582         return;
583
584      Level level = Utils.firstNonNull(rule.getLevel(), this.level);
585
586      if (level == Level.OFF)
587         return;
588
589      Throwable e = Utils.castOrNull(req.getAttribute("Exception"), Throwable.class);
590      Long execTime = Utils.castOrNull(req.getAttribute("ExecTime"), Long.class);
591
592      CallLoggingDetail reqd = Utils.firstNonNull(rule.getRequestDetail(), requestDetail);
593      CallLoggingDetail resd = Utils.firstNonNull(rule.getResponseDetail(), responseDetail);
594
595      String method = req.getMethod();
596      int status = res.getStatus();
597      String uri = req.getRequestURI();
598      byte[] reqContent = getRequestContent(req);
599      byte[] resContent = getResponseContent(req, res);
600
601      StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
602
603      if (reqd != STATUS_LINE || resd != STATUS_LINE)
604         sb.append("\n=== HTTP Call (incoming) ======================================================\n");
605
606      ThrownStats sti = getThrownStats(e);
607
608      sb.append('[').append(status);
609
610      if (sti != null) {
611         int count = sti.getCount();
612         sb.append(',').append(StringUtils.toHex8(sti.getHash())).append('.').append(count);
613         if (count > 1)
614            e = null;
615      }
616
617      sb.append("] ");
618
619      sb.append("HTTP ").append(method).append(' ').append(uri);
620
621      if (reqd != STATUS_LINE || resd != STATUS_LINE) {
622
623         if (reqd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
624            String qs = req.getQueryString();
625            if (qs != null)
626               sb.append('?').append(qs);
627         }
628
629         if (reqContent != null && reqd.isOneOf(HEADER ,ENTITY))
630            sb.append("\n\tRequest length: ").append(reqContent.length).append(" bytes");
631
632         if (resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
633            sb.append("\n\tResponse code: ").append(status);
634
635         if (resContent != null && resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
636            sb.append("\n\tResponse length: ").append(resContent.length).append(" bytes");
637
638         if (execTime != null && resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY))
639            sb.append("\n\tExec time: ").append(execTime).append("ms");
640
641         if (reqd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
642            Enumeration<String> hh = req.getHeaderNames();
643            if (hh.hasMoreElements()) {
644               sb.append("\n---Request Headers---");
645               while (hh.hasMoreElements()) {
646                  String h = hh.nextElement();
647                  sb.append("\n\t").append(h).append(": ").append(req.getHeader(h));
648               }
649            }
650         }
651
652         if (resd.isOneOf(HEADER, ENTITY)) {
653            Collection<String> hh = res.getHeaderNames();
654            if (hh.size() > 0) {
655               sb.append("\n---Response Headers---");
656               for (String h : hh) {
657                  sb.append("\n\t").append(h).append(": ").append(res.getHeader(h));
658               }
659            }
660         }
661
662         if (reqContent != null && reqContent.length > 0 && reqd == ENTITY) {
663            try {
664               sb.append("\n---Request Content UTF-8---");
665               sb.append("\n").append(new String(reqContent, IOUtils.UTF8));
666               sb.append("\n---Request Content Hex---");
667               sb.append("\n").append(toSpacedHex(reqContent));
668            } catch (Exception e1) {
669               sb.append("\n").append(e1.getLocalizedMessage());
670            }
671         }
672
673         if (resContent != null && resContent.length > 0 && resd == ENTITY) {
674            try {
675               sb.append("\n---Response Content UTF-8---");
676               sb.append("\n").append(new String(resContent, IOUtils.UTF8));
677               sb.append("\n---Response Content Hex---");
678               sb.append("\n").append(toSpacedHex(resContent));
679            } catch (Exception e1) {
680               sb.append(e1.getLocalizedMessage());
681            }
682         }
683         sb.append("\n=== END ======================================================================");
684      }
685
686      log(level, sb.toString(), e);
687
688   }
689
690   /**
691    * Given the specified servlet request/response, find the rule that applies to it.
692    *
693    * <p>
694    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for finding rules.
695    *
696    * @param req The servlet request.
697    * @param res The servlet response.
698    * @return The applicable logging rule, or the default rule if not found.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
699    */
700   protected CallLoggerRule getRule(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
701      for (CallLoggerRule r : isDebug(req) ? debugRules : normalRules)
702         if (r.matches(req, res))
703            return r;
704      return DEFAULT_RULE;
705   }
706
707   /**
708    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled on this request.
709    *
710    * <p>
711    * Looks for the request attribute <js>"Debug"</js> to determine whether debug is enabled.
712    *
713    * <p>
714    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for determining whether debug mode is enabled on a request.
715    *
716    * @param req The HTTP request being logged.
717    * @return <jk>true</jk> if debug is enabled on this request.
718    * @see org.apache.juneau.rest.RestContext.Builder#debugEnablement()
719    * @see Rest#debug()
720    * @see RestOp#debug()
721    */
722   protected boolean isDebug(HttpServletRequest req) {
723      return Utils.firstNonNull(Utils.castOrNull(req.getAttribute("Debug"), Boolean.class), false);
724   }
725
726   /**
727    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if logging is enabled for this request.
728    *
729    * <p>
730    * Uses the enabled and enabled-test settings on the matched rule and this logger to determine whether a REST
731    * call should be logged.
732    *
733    * <p>
734    * This method can be overridden to provide specialized logic for determining whether a REST call should be logged.
735    *
736    * @param rule The first matching rule.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
737    * @param req The HTTP request.
738    * @return <jk>true</jk> if logging is enabled for this request.
739    */
740   protected boolean isEnabled(CallLoggerRule rule, HttpServletRequest req) {
741      Enablement enabled = Utils.firstNonNull(rule.getEnabled(), this.enabled);
742      Predicate<HttpServletRequest> enabledTest = Utils.firstNonNull(rule.getEnabledTest(), this.enabledTest);
743      return enabled.isEnabled(enabledTest.test(req));
744   }
745
746   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
747   // Other methods
748   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
749
750   /**
751    * Returns the logger to use for logging REST calls.
752    *
753    * <p>
754    * Returns the logger specified in the builder, or {@link Logger#getGlobal()} if it wasn't specified.
755    *
756    * <p>
757    * This method can be overridden in subclasses to provide a different logger.
758    *
759    * @return The logger to use for logging REST calls.
760    */
761   protected Logger getLogger() {
762      return logger;
763   }
764
765   /**
766    * Logs the specified message to the logger.
767    *
768    * <p>
769    * Subclasses can override this method to capture messages being sent to the logger and handle it differently.
770    *
771    * @param level The log level.
772    * @param msg The log message.
773    * @param e The exception.
774    */
775   protected void log(Level level, String msg, Throwable e) {
776      getLogger().log(level, msg, e);
777   }
778
779   private byte[] getRequestContent(HttpServletRequest req) {
780      if (req instanceof CachingHttpServletRequest)
781         return ((CachingHttpServletRequest)req).getContent();
782      return Utils.castOrNull(req.getAttribute("RequestContent"), byte[].class);
783   }
784
785   private byte[] getResponseContent(HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse res) {
786      if (res instanceof CachingHttpServletResponse)
787         return ((CachingHttpServletResponse)res).getContent();
788      return Utils.castOrNull(req.getAttribute("ResponseContent"), byte[].class);
789   }
790
791   private ThrownStats getThrownStats(Throwable e) {
792      if (e == null || thrownStore == null)
793         return null;
794      return thrownStore.getStats(e).orElse(null);
795   }
796
797   @Override /* Object */
798   public String toString() {
799      return filteredMap()
800         .append("logger", logger)
801         .append("thrownStore", thrownStore)
802         .append("enabled", enabled)
803         .append("level", level)
804         .append("requestDetail", requestDetail)
805         .append("responseDetail", responseDetail)
806         .append("normalRules", normalRules.length == 0 ? null : normalRules)
807         .append("debugRules", debugRules.length == 0 ? null : debugRules)
808         .asReadableString();
809   }
810}
